title: Asthma
desc: Asthma is a long-term disease of the lungs. It causes your airways to get inflamed and narrow, and it makes it hard to breathe

title: Cardiology
desc: Cardiology is the study and treatment of disorders of the heart and the blood vessels. A person with heart disease or cardiovascular disease may be referred to a cardiologist.

title: Cancer
desc: Cancer is a condition where cells in a specific part of the body grow and reproduce uncontrollably.

title: Skin Allergy
desc: Irritated skin can be caused by a variety of factors. These include immune system disorders, medications and infections.

title: Brain Tumour
desc: A brain tumor is a mass or growth of abnormal cells in your brain. Many different types of brain tumors exist.

title: Kidney Transplant
desc: Kidney transplant or renal transplant is the organ transplant of a kidney into a patient with end-stage kidney disease.

title: Diabetes
desc: Diabetes is a chronic (long-lasting) health condition that affects how your body turns food into energy

title: Eye care
desc: Your eyesight is one of your most important senses: 80% of what we perceive comes through our sense of sight.

title: Pediatrics
desc: Paediatrics is the branch of medicine that involves the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents.
